column2: Desertrat, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Taking for muscle spasm and restless leg syndrome.  I have fibromyalgia.  The restless leg syndrome is completely gone, however the muscle spasms are still bothering me.  I take 4 mg. at night.  Dr. stated that I should go to bed upon taking med.  It sure helps me to get to sleep, however, within 2-4 hours my foot spasms are horrendous.  Going to talk to doctor about dosage.  At first it didn't work for me, but I started taking clonazepam a couple of hours prior and that helped to relax me and then tizanidine worked fast and I went to sleep easier than I have in years.  Just wondering if I need a larger dosage for the spasms.  As for other symptoms... I find that I am having regular bowel movements now so I believe it is helping my IBS.  The only side effect I have had is that you do get sleepy and dizzy if you do not follow drs. instructions of going to bed immediately.

column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column2: Pass on this one!!!! , 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I've had a chronic bad back after a severe fall. Yesteray woke up with horrendouos spasms. My doctor is really excellent he switched me from flexoril which was so-so for me to tizaniniine. Got as shot of toraol which helped and then went and ate dinner. WITHIN 15 minutes I felt drunk as could be I couldn't walk without assistance. I fell in the garage (thank god I wasn't driving) on the way into the house and i thought it was just me until I got on here but I swear I was hallucinating. I could not even hold my head up sitting up my neck muscles didn't seem to work. FYI I am 6'1 195 and took oly one (and the last one) 4mg tablet. I went to sleep withinn the hour but woke up 3 times an here it is midight and I am awake and my back still hurts. Oh and my mouth was like the Sahara dessert I had to get up to get a glass of water and nearly fell on my face. I've tried alot of medications over the 14yrs since the accident but this one is THE worst. We all react differently but this one an my body did NOT mix well.

column9: My neurologist prescribed 2, 4mg tabs pm, and 1-2 tabs during the day for migraines.  But, I only take the pm dosage. I have had migraines for several years now. I'm a 51 yo menopausal female. I have been taking this med along with other meds to control my migraines. I have been on this new med. for about 6wks now.  I makes me sleep for about 2hrs, but after that I toss and turn and have a hard time going back to sleep.  I noticed I was having nightmares and "seeing things".  I thought it might be this med.  Now, that I have heard from others, I'm sure it is.  But, it has really helped with my migraines.  Knock-on-wood...I haven't had one this month.  I see my neurologist next month, so I will talk with him about side effects versus the benefits.  Good luck with your treatments.

column2: Sharontjsmom, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have severe diabetic neuropathy in my hands and feet.I also have pinched nerves in my lower spine. It is very painful. I have tried many narcotics and nerve pain relievers with poor results. When I combine tizanidine with narcotics the results are excellent. This medication has changed my life. I've found that I get severe constipation at times but it is worth it. This particular muscle relaxer is the only one that seems to work on me. I thank God and my doctors for stumbling upon this drug! Beware of withdrawal syptoms if you run out! They are as agonizing as narcotic withdrawal symptoms! Overall, tizanidine is a personal miracle for me....

column2: CANCAN, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Only been on this med for a month but it does help with strength of migraines, sometimes stops the migraine..a blessing for me since I have suffered for 64 years with them. I take 1/4 every 8 hours, then 2-3 tabs at bedtime. They will make you groggy if taken with other meds, so must be careful...pain specialist will adjust other meds in one month.  Has helped with shakiness...I like this drug but if not regulated/adjusted to each individual...it could be negative for them...I say keep adjusting, it is a miracle drug! If active and driving, take lowest dosage...or none, since it reacts differently to different people. Had one hallucination but none since...just be careful of interactions with other meds.  I think it is good for me once I get to know how to adjust to my body!

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
LST863, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been having Chronic tension headaches everyday for almost 3 years! I have been taking NSAID Exedrin aspirin reduce my headache pain. I went to see Neurologist doctor. He said the Exedrin aspirin isn't good because it gave me a rebound headaches! I decided to quit Exedrin which it wasn't easy! I only can take Tylenol if I get bad headaches. He prescribed me Tizanidine pills. I decided to take 2 Tizanidine pills 4mg at bedtime. It didn't give me any bad side effects. It helped me to sleep through the night. Few months later, my daily headaches were tapered little by little! Now, I no longer have chronic headaches! I adviced you all, pls do not take NSAID Exedrin aspirin. It can cause daily and rebound headaches. It's best to take Tylenol. It's safe.

column2: Aub, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Well, I was a little hesitant to take this medication because of some of the side effects I read on here first.I did however notice that someone had split the pill on here so, I took 1/4 of a 4mg pill before bed last night. within 10 min I noticed I felt VERY relaxed, kinda drunk and did have strange thought in my head.I also noticed I didn't wake up to use the bathroom untill it was almost an emergency.(Oh,boy!) What I did like was it did not give me a racing heart rate like all the other muscle relaxers did. I felt some relief this morning and will take 1/2 a pill tonight. I do feel a little tired today but, thats nothing new for me since my car accident.I think I finally found a medication that is going to work on these terrible muscle spasms I have been dealing with for over a year.I really had given up on something that will work and just figured this is how Im gonna feel.If you had bad experiences with muscle relaxers,its worth a try just start off slow.The pills are scored so you can break them in to a smaller dose.

column2: Ferncloud, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have muscle spasms in my back, shoulders, & neck caused by stenosis and scoliosis.  The spasms worsen over night unless I take a tizanidine at bedtime.  If the spasms are very bad (they often lead to migraines) or if they have not been adequately controlled for several nights with one pill, I take two at bedtime.  It's been effective for minimizing them.  Tizanidine helps the spasms I have in the day, too, but usally makes me sleepy and my body too loose, so I only take one during the day if I have a lot of pain.  I have had a lot of weird reactions to other medications, but this is one of the few that has not caused scary side effects.

column9: For me, this medication has been a God send. I have 2 herniated disc, 1 bulging disc in my lower back and degenerative disc disease. I have been on countless meds. I've had epidurals, injections, and have even had one Dr. suggest surgery. Too many "war" stories for me to take that into consideration, but I am going to a pain clinic, I am on pain medication, Zanaflex(tizanidine) and even recently fitted for a TENS unit and I have my life back. Not nearly all of it, I'm still in the process of filing for disability because I was a paramedic and that line of work in most definately out of the question. But just to say, to anyone of you out there that has to go through issues like I have, try to be patient, not all meds work the same way it does for others. The right combination is out there, just be sure to pick out a doctor that listens to you and has an open-mind. Good Luck and God Bless.

column2: Becky, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Of course, medications react different on all people. The 1st time I took it (4mg tablet), I got up in the middle of the night to go to the bathroom and passed out.  I yelled out for my husband as soon as I felt the blood draining from my head.  We called the Doctor the next morning and he said, this is not the type of med you take to function, including walking,:-), at least not in the beginning.   I can take ¼ of a tablet and it puts me out, if you want to be unconscious, then this is the medication.  However, my 35-year-old son took it and he was a little dazed, but was fine.  For me, I could not even function the next day.  Therefore, it depends on the person.  I have been taking this med off and on for several years.  I have ruptured discs in my back and neck, diagnosed with Lupus 2 years ago and recently diagnosed with MS, but I am allergic to many medications, including Ibuprofen, Advil, etc., so when I find something I can take  then I go for it.  Right now, I have a script for the ZanaFlex (Tizanidine) that expired January 2008  I can take ½ a tablet at night, sleep pretty well and not have the drugged out effect the next morning.  My Pharmacist said the med was fine; it has just weakened.  That is the only way I can take it.  So, this is a medication you have to start off slowly with, but you may find that it will really help with muscle spasms and pain. So, I say break them & only take a portion, until your body adjusts.  It really does work great with muscle and bone pain.
